answers.answer: Hi,Are there other symptoms present? The most common cause of enlarged kidneys is diabetes. Other causes of enlarged kidneys,include: Amyloidosis, HIV infection, malignancy, and some types of glomerulonephritis or inflammatory disease of the kidney.  What was the result of the urinalysis or  kidney function tests? It would be best if your daughter be referred to a nephrologist for further evaluation after the ct scan.You can read more about Turner syndrome with this link: http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/000379.htmTake care and regards.

question: My daughter is 16 and has a possibility of having Turner Syndrome--the doctor just did an ultra sound and seems to have found an enlarged kidney.  He wants her to have a ct scan this week.  Could this possibly be cancerous ?  Thankyou.
title: Enlarged kidney/possible cause of Turner syndrom
